title: Accessibility and responsive tests
description: Add automated accessibility auditing using @axe-core/playwright and responsive design tests at mobile and tablet viewports. Test key pages for WCAG compliance, colour contrast, ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, and usability across breakpoints.
acceptance_criteria: tests/e2e/accessibility.spec.ts tests key pages with axe-core
Accessibility tested on: login, dashboard, player availability, standings
No critical or serious a11y violations on tested pages
ARIA labels and keyboard navigation checked
tests/e2e/responsive.spec.ts tests key pages at mobile (375px) and tablet (768px)
Navigation menu works at all breakpoints
Key pages are usable at mobile and tablet sizes

approach: 3. For each key page: navigate, run axe analysis, assert no critical/serious violations
5. Responsive test: set viewport to 375x812 (mobile), test navigation, key pages
6. Responsive test: set viewport to 768x1024 (tablet), test navigation, key pages
7. Verify hamburger menu / responsive nav works at mobile breakpoint
8. Verify tables and forms are usable at narrow viewports
technical_notes.existing_code: Layout template at templates/layout.html defines the responsive structure. Navigation likely in layout.html header/sidebar.

testing_requirements: Axe-core produces no critical accessibility violations
Key pages render correctly at 375px mobile viewport
Key pages render correctly at 768px tablet viewport
Navigation is accessible and usable at all tested viewports

context.user_story: As a developer, I want automated accessibility and responsive tests so I can catch a11y regressions and layout breakages early
